skill.name: verification-protocol
skill.description: Independent verification of task completion - eliminates self-attestation
skill.summary: Independent verification of task completion - eliminates self-attestation
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill defining verification protocols. No executable code exists. All 73 static findings are false positives: scanner misinterpreted documentation examples and metadata as security threats. Contains only Markdown documentation describing independent verification methods for AI task completion.

content.user_title: Verify AI Task Completion with Evidence
content.value_statement: AI agents often claim success without proof. This protocol forces independent verification with concrete evidence before marking tasks complete. It eliminates false completions and ensures quality through objective validation.
actual_capabilities: Defines verification criteria for file existence and content
Specifies compilation and linting validation requirements
Mandates test execution with pass/fail evidence
Provides structured evidence format for audit trails
limitations: Documentation-only skill with no executable code
Requires implementation by AI agent framework
Dependent on external tools (tsc, eslint, npm test)

use_cases.title: Prevent False Task Completions
use_cases.description: Stop agents from marking tasks complete without proof. Independent verification catches incomplete work before it reaches production.

use_cases.title: Standardize AI Verification
use_cases.description: Consistent verification criteria across all AI agents. Every completion requires measurable evidence, not subjective claims.

use_cases.title: Audit AI Work Quality
use_cases.description: Track actual completion rates with evidence trails. Identify which agents need improvement through verification failure patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic File Verification
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify a TypeScript file was created correctly
prompt_templates.prompt: Use verification protocol to check if /src/lib/feature.ts exists, has no placeholders, compiles without errors, passes linting, and has working tests. Return evidence for each criterion.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-File Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify feature implementation across multiple files: check all claimed outputs exist, contain no TODOs, compile successfully, and pass all tests. Collect evidence for each file.

prompt_templates.title: API Endpoint Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if API endpoints respond correctly: GET /api/users returns 200, POST /api/users creates records, error handling works. Provide status codes and response samples as evidence.

prompt_templates.title: Complex System Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify complete system: database migrations applied, API routes accessible, frontend builds without errors, all tests pass, monitoring endpoints respond. Provide comprehensive evidence trail.

output_examples.input: Verify that the new user authentication feature is complete
output: API endpoint test: POST /api/login returns 200 with JWT token
Verification result: PASSED - All criteria met with evidence

best_practices: Always use independent verifier agent, never verify your own work
Collect specific evidence for each verification criterion
Block task completion when any verification fails
anti_patterns: Self-attestation: Agent claiming its own work is complete
Assumed success: Marking complete without checking evidence
Loose verification: Accepting partial or unclear results

faq.question: Is this compatible with all AI platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, the protocol is platform-agnostic and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What happens after 3 verification failures?
faq.answer: Task automatically escalates to human review with full failure history and evidence.

faq.question: Can I customize the verification criteria?
faq.answer: Yes, you can define custom completion criteria specific to your project needs.

faq.question: How does this protect my data?
faq.answer: Verification happens locally with no external data transmission. Evidence stays in your system.

faq.question: What if verification tools are not available?
faq.answer: Protocol gracefully handles missing tools and reports what could not be verified.

faq.question: How is this different from regular testing?
faq.answer: This verifies actual completion of claimed work, not just running predefined tests.
